action.action-desc: Mr. Brown (for himself, Mr. Merkley, Mr. Blumenthal, Mr. Durbin, and Mr. Franken) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend title 11, United States Code, to require creditors to inform consumer reporting agencies that certain debts have been discharged in bankruptcy cases.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Consumer Reporting Fairness Act of 2015.
Section 525 of title 11, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:

subsection.text: If a creditor has provided or furnished to a consumer reporting agency, as defined in section 603 of the Fair Credit Reporting Act (15 U.S.C. 1681a), any item of information pertaining to an account based on a debt discharged in a case under this title, the creditor shall inform the consumer reporting agency that the debt has been discharged in bankruptcy and has a zero balance.

subsection.text: Nothing in this section shall be construed to prohibit the reporting of payments on a mortgage loan, whether or not the debtor has reaffirmed that loan.
